snippet: Prostate cancer patients often delay chemotherapy, fearing its side effects, but the new research could upend established practices.
abstract: Study presented at the annual meeting of the American Society of Clinical Oncology finds that men given chemotherapy early in their treatment for prostate cancer live median of nearly 14 months longer than those who do not get early chemotherapy; separate study finds that drugs called aromatase inhibitors may be better than others in preventing recurrence of disease in premenopausal women with early breast cancer.
lead_paragraph: Prostate cancer patients often delay chemotherapy, fearing its side effects, but the new research could upend established practices.

headline.main: Study May Alter Approach to Prostate Cancer
headline.print_headline: Study May Alter Approach to Prostate Cancer
